body_html:
Yes that probably can work. If not, make sure that cmake searches the directory.
…
On Thu, Mar 22, 2018 at 20:06 Neeraj Pradhan ***@***.***> wrote: @neerajprad <https://github.com/neerajprad> This error only happens if cmake finds mkl but not mkl headers. The header files are unfortunately not there. I can see the following commands in the Dockerfile. So maybe we just need to copy the header files in the include directory and put them here? # MKL RUN mkdir -p /opt/intel/lib COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_core.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_core.a COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_gnu_thread.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_gnu_thread.a COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_intel_lp64.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_intel_lp64.a — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#5933 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFaWZTXd5jrboXq6yfffHXJt2GSjDfEgks5thDxpgaJpZM4S2ipQ> .
body_text:
Yes that probably can work. If not, make sure that cmake searches the
directory.
…
On Thu, Mar 22, 2018 at 20:06 Neeraj Pradhan ***@***.***> wrote:
 @neerajprad <https://github.com/neerajprad> This error only happens if
 cmake finds mkl but not mkl headers.

 The header files are unfortunately not there. I can see the following
 commands in the Dockerfile. So maybe we just need to copy the header files
 in the include directory and put them here?

 # MKL
 RUN mkdir -p /opt/intel/lib
 COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_core.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_core.a
 COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_gnu_thread.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_gnu_thread.a
 COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_intel_lp64.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_intel_lp64.a

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#5933 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFaWZTXd5jrboXq6yfffHXJt2GSjDfEgks5thDxpgaJpZM4S2ipQ>
 .
body:
Yes that probably can work. If not, make sure that cmake searches the
directory.

On Thu, Mar 22, 2018 at 20:06 Neeraj Pradhan <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @neerajprad <https://github.com/neerajprad> This error only happens if
> cmake finds mkl but not mkl headers.
>
> The header files are unfortunately not there. I can see the following
> commands in the Dockerfile. So maybe we just need to copy the header files
> in the include directory and put them here?
>
> # MKL
> RUN mkdir -p /opt/intel/lib
> COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_core.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_core.a
> COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_gnu_thread.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_gnu_thread.a
> COPY mkl_libs/libmkl_intel_lp64.a /opt/intel/lib/libmkl_intel_lp64.a
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/5933#issuecomment-375497247>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFaWZTXd5jrboXq6yfffHXJt2GSjDfEgks5thDxpgaJpZM4S2ipQ>
> .
>
